1.text: My brothers, as you hold out your faith in our glorious Lord Jesus Christ, do not show favoritism.

2.text: Suppose a man comes into your meeting wearing a gold ring and fine clothes, and a poor man in shabby clothes also comes in.

3.text: If you lavish attention on the man in fine clothes and say, “Here is a seat of honor,” but say to the poor man, “You must stand” or “Sit at my feet,”

4.text: have you not discriminated among yourselves and become judges with evil thoughts?

5.text: Listen, my beloved brothers: Has not God chosen the poor of this world to be rich in faith and to inherit the kingdom He promised those who love Him?

6.text: But you have dishonored the poor. Is it not the rich who oppress you and drag you into court?

7.text: Are they not the ones who blaspheme the noble name by which you have been called?

8.text: If you really fulfill the royal law stated in Scripture, “Love your neighbor as yourself,” you are doing well.

9.text: But if you show favoritism, you sin and are convicted by the law as transgressors.

10.text: Whoever keeps the whole law but stumbles at just one point is guilty of breaking all of it.

11.text: For He who said, “Do not commit adultery,” also said, “Do not murder.” If you do not commit adultery, but do commit murder, you have become a lawbreaker.

12.text: Speak and act as those who are going to be judged by the law that gives freedom.

13.text: For judgment without mercy will be shown to anyone who has not been merciful. Mercy triumphs over judgment.

14.text: What good is it, my brothers, if someone claims to have faith, but has no deeds? Can such faith save him?

15.text: Suppose a brother or sister is without clothes and daily food.

16.text: If one of you tells him, “Go in peace; stay warm and well fed,” but does not provide for his physical needs, what good is that?

17.text: So too, faith by itself, if it does not result in action, is dead.

18.text: But someone will say, “You have faith and I have deeds.” Show me your faith without deeds, and I will show you my faith by my deeds.

19.text: You believe that God is one. Good for you! Even the demons believe that—and shudder.

20.text: O foolish man, do you want evidence that faith without deeds is worthless?

21.text: Was not our father Abraham justified by what he did when he offered his son Isaac on the altar?

22.text: You see that his faith was working with his actions, and his faith was perfected by what he did.

23.text: And the Scripture was fulfilled that says, “Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness,” and he was called a friend of God.

24.text: As you can see, a man is justified by his deeds and not by faith alone.

25.text: In the same way, was not even Rahab the prostitute justified by her actions when she welcomed the spies and sent them off on another route?

26.text: As the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without deeds is dead.
